page.title: 14Place names
page.content: The Welsh name for Holyhead is Caergybi.It is interesting to note that the name can be split into two: Caer and Cybi. Caer is the Welsh name for a fort, this refers to the old Roman fort,the walls of which can still be seen. Cybi;this is the name given to an ancient Welsh saint who had his small church near the walls of the fort but during a later period in history. St Cybi's church is open to the public where a variety of artifacts can be seen,as wellas some well appointed stained glass windows.
